DOC.brief_summary: To establish bioequivalence 80 mg telmisartan/12.5 mg HCTZ fix dose combination vs. monocomponents
DOC.brief_title: Bioequivalence Telmisartan / HCTZ Fixed Dose Combination Compared Its Monocomponents Healthy Male Volunteers
DOC.criteria: 1 . Healthy male accord follow criterion : Based upon complete medical history , physical finding , physical examination ( measurement height body weight ) , vital sign ( blood pressure ( BP ) , pulse rate ( PR ) ) , 12lead ECG ( electrocardiogram ) , clinical laboratory test 1 ) No find clinical relevance 2 ) No evidence clinically relevant concomitant disease 2 . Age ≥ 20 year age ≤ 35 year 3 . Body Mass Index ( BMI ) ≥ 17.6 kg/m2 BMI ≤ 25.0 kg/m2 4 . Signed date write informed consent prior admission study accordance Good Clinical Practice ( GCP ) ( MHW Ordinance No . 28 , Mar . 27 , 1997 ) local legislation 1 . Gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunological hormonal disorder 2 . Surgery gastrointestinal tract ( except appendectomy ) 3 . Diseases central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder 4 . History relevant orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts 5 . Chronic relevant acute infection 6 . History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator 7 .
